Name: aldehyde
reason: reagent, lysine trap (IGF-1R inh; dx.doi.org/10.1021/jm3003203), serine trap (wheat ser-carboxypeptidase, pdb 1BCS), metabolically unstable (substrate of aldehyde oxidase, ref 10.1021/jm100888d)

Name: poly acidic
reason: poor exposure, toxicophore (hepatotox by glucuronidation, ref PMID: 15582794 )

Name: beta-lactone
reason: serine trap (eg orlistat, not bioavailable though)

Name: 5-alkoxy gamma-lactone
reason: cysteine trap (masked aldehyde released after hydrolysis of alkoxy: see caspase inhibitor Pralnacasan)

Name: arginine aldehyde
reason: serine trap (masked aldehyde in wheat Serine Carboxypeptidase II inh see pdb 1BCR; doi:10.1006/jmbi.1996.0058)

Name: alpha-ketoamide
reason: serine trap (ia HCV reversible inh Telaprevir and Boceprevir;thombin inhibition pdb 1a46)

Name: 2-keto-azole
reason: serine trap (FAAH inh OL-135 is reversible; thombin pdb 1a61), metal chelator

Name: unstable carbamate
reason: unstable, serine trap (ia AChE inh Rivastigmine)

Name: aryl-urea
reason: serine trap (reversible) (eg FAAH inh JNJ-1661010/Takeda-25, PF-04457845)

Name: azol-urea
reason: serine trap (reversible) (eg tetrazol-urea LY-2183240 is a non selective FAAH inh; not developped and imidazol-urea BIA 10-2474 caused serious adverse events in a PhI clinical trial in Jan2016)

Name: terminal acyl c-Pr
reason: toxicophore precursor (cyclopropane carboxylic acid is hepatotox)

Name: benzodioxolane
reason: toxicophore precursor (mechanism based inhibition of P450, quasi-irreversible carbene, see 10.1021/jm300065h)

Name: hydrazine derivative
reason: toxicophore precursor (mechanism based inhibition of P450), (heme alkylation, see 10.1021/jm300065h)

Name: aniline or precursor
reason: toxicophore precursor (ia oxidized into genotox, hepatotox and methemoglobin-forming metabolites)

Name: more-than-2 anilines
reason: toxicophore precursor (ia oxidized into genotox, hepatotox and methemoglobin-forming metabolites)

Name: terminal alkyl amine
reason: toxicophore precursor (mechanism based inhibition of P450)

Name: cyanamide
reason: cysteine trap (eg Deubiquitinase cyanopyrrolidine inhibitors, Cath K inh)

Name: aromatic nitro
reason: toxicophore precursor (reduced into genotoxic and methemoglobin-forming metabolites)

Name: more-than-1 nitro
reason: toxicophore precursor (reduced into genotoxic and methemoglobin-forming metabolites)

Name: o-CF3-nitrobenzene
reason: toxicophore (ia androgen receptor antagonists Flutamide and Nilutamide have black box warnings owing to a relatively high incidence of liver and lung injury associated with their use)

Name: nitro or nitroso on double bond
reason: metabolically unstable (substrate of aldehyde oxidase, ref 10.1021/jm100888d)

Name: peroxide
reason: reagent, toxicophore precursor (forms reactive oxygen species)

Name: pyrogallol
reason: aggretates proteins, frequent hitter (ia gallic tannins, ellagic tannins)

Name: (thio)epoxide
reason: reagent, toxicophore (mechanism based inhibition of P450), serine trap (Thr for proteazome inh Carfilzomib)

Name: thiol
reason: reagent (reductive), metal binder (eg, ACE inh captopril, MetalloBetaLactamases), cysteine trap

Name: phosphin(i,o)nic acid
reason: metal binder (active metabolite of ACE inh Fosinopril)

Name: phosphine oxide
reason: level should be revised since Brigatinib exhibits this moiety

Name: acrylamide derivative
reason: serine trap (Michael acceptor, ia 5-alpha reductase inh finasteride, dutasteride), cysteine trap (kinase inh: canertinib, neratinib, afatinib, dacomitinib; dx.doi.org/10.1021/jm3003203)

Name: Michael alkyne acceptor
reason: reactive group, cysteine trap (kinase inh; dx.doi.org/10.1021/jm3003203)

Name: polyene
reason: toxicophore precursor (mechanism based inhibition of P450)

Name: terminal alkene
reason: toxicophore precursor (mechanism based inhibition of P450)

Name: terminal alkyne
reason: toxicophore precursor (mechanism based inhibition of P450), FAD in MOA-B covalently binds Seleginine via its terminal alkyne

Name: unsaturated alkyl
reason: toxicophore precursor (mechanism based inhibition of P450)

Name: reactive succinimide, N-activated phthalimide or saccharin
toxoflavin-fervenulin derivatives
reason: frequent hitter (redox cycler; can produce H2O2)

Name: cyclohexadienone
reason: reagent (Michael acceptor), serine trap, toxicophore (liver failure by GSH depletion)

Name: o-quinone direct precursor
reason: toxicophore precursor (liver failure by GSH depletion)

Name: p-quinone direct precursor
reason: toxicophore precursor (liver failure by GSH depletion)

Name: S or N benzo[b]furazane
reason: frequent hitter (sulfamoyl or nitro-benzofurazanes interfere with fluorescence-based assays)

Name: non-fused furan
reason: toxicophore precursor (mechanism based inhibition of P450) (see PMID 23061605)

Name: e-rich indole
reason: toxicophore precursor (liver failure by GSH depletion)

Name: e-rich benzofuran
reason: toxicophore precursor (liver failure by GSH depletion)

Name: thiazole
reason: toxicophore precursor (mechanism based inhibition of P450) (ia HIV protease inhibitors Ritonavir, Cobicistat, see 10.1021/jm300065h)

Name: N-amino triazole
reason: toxicophore precursor (mechanism based inhibition of P450), (heme alkylation, see 10.1021/jm300065h)

Name: aryl boronic
reason: serine trap (eg Thr trap in autotaxin inh), zinc binder (eg autotaxin)

Name: alkyl boronic
reason: serine trap (eg Thr trap proteazome inh Bortezomib)
